contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Settlement |name = Góra County |native_name=Powiat górowski |settlement_type=[[Powiat|County]] |image_flag = |image_shield = POL powiat górowski COA.svg |image_map = POL powiat górowski map.svg |map_caption=Location within the voivodeship |subdivision_type=Country |subdivision_name={{POL}} |subdivision_type1=[[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] |subdivision_name1=[[Lower Silesian Voivodeship|Lower Silesian]] |seat = [[Góra]] |parts_type = [[Gmina]]s |parts = Total 4 |p1=[[Gmina Góra]]|p2=[[Gmina Jemielno]]|p3=[[Gmina Niechlów]]|p4=[[Gmina Wąsosz, Lower Silesian Voivodeship|Gmina Wąsosz]] |area_total_km2 = 738.11 |total_type=Total |population_total = 36556 |population_as_of = 2006 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_urban=15402 |population_blank1_title=Rural |population_blank1=21154 |blank_name=[[Polish car number plates|Car plates]] |blank_info=DGR |website=http://www.powiatgora.pl/ }} __NOTOC__ '''Góra County''' ({{lang-pl|powiat górowski}}) is a unit of territorial administration and local government ([[powiat]]) in [[Lower Silesian Voivodeship]], south-western [[Poland]]. It came into being on January 1, 1999, as a result of the [[Polish local government reforms]] passed in 1998. The county covers an area of {{convert|738.11|km2|sqmi|1}}. Its administrative seat is the town of [[Góra]]; the only other town in the county is [[Wąsosz]]. As at 2006 the total population of the county is 36,556, out of which the population of Góra is 12,574, the population of Wąsosz is 2,828, and the rural population is 21,154. == Neighbouring counties == Góra County is bordered by [[Leszno County]] to the north, [[Rawicz County]] to the east, [[Trzebnica County]] to the south-east, [[Wołów County]] to the south, [[Lubin County]] to the south-west, [[Głogów County]] to the west and [[Wschowa County]] to the north-west. == Administrative division == The county is subdivided into four [[gmina]]s (two urban-rural and two rural). These are listed in the following table, in descending order of population. {| width="60%" border="2" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" style="font-size:90%;line-height:120%;" |-bgcolor="F0F8FF" | style="text-align:center;"|'''Gmina''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Type''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Area<br><small>(km²)</small>''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Population<br><small>(2006)</small>''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Seat''' |- |[[Gmina Góra]] |urban-rural | style="text-align:right;"|268.7 | style="text-align:right;"|20,876 |[[Góra]] |- |[[Gmina Wąsosz, Lower Silesian Voivodeship|Gmina Wąsosz]] |urban-rural | style="text-align:right;"|193.6 | style="text-align:right;"|7,444 |[[Wąsosz]] |- |[[Gmina Niechlów]] |rural | style="text-align:right;"|152.0 | style="text-align:right;"|5,140 |[[Niechlów]] |- |[[Gmina Jemielno]] |rural | style="text-align:right;"|123.8 | style="text-align:right;"|3,096 |[[Jemielno]] |- |} ==References== *[http://www.stat.gov.pl/gus/45_655_PLK_HTML.htm Polish official population figures 2006] <br> {{Góra County}} {{Lower Silesian Voivodeship}} {{coord|51|40|N|16|33|E|type:adm2nd_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Góra County| ]] [[Category:Land counties of Lower Silesian Voivodeship|Gora]]
